result.execSummary:
The defendant Ira O. Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ira O. Davis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ira O. Davis was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. May Not have contact with Julie Carpenter unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.    May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

from deft.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney M Barth. Clerk/H. Barnett. Case set for jury selection. Atty Barth submits a letter to the court from deft which states he wants to have new counsel. Court denies deft's request for new counsel. Court notes that Atty Barth made an oral motion to adjourn the trial last week and a phone conference was held with Atty Barth, ADA Phan and the court at which time the court denied the motion to withdraw. Ludwig hearing held; deft indicates he wishes to accept the State's offer. On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed. Deft pleads guilty. Court finds deft guilty. PSI waived. Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge, bond applied to costs, any remainder applied to costs in file 16CF479, any remainder thereafter to be returned to poster. No contact with Julie C.
AMENDED - And Demand for Discovery - Filed by ADA J Phan

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Hans Koesser. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Koesser. Tab pulled for Judge Wagner. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. DAPT on 1-16-15 @ 1:30pm. Judicial pretrial on 2-5-15 @ 8:45am. Atty. Koesser moves for bond reduction. State waives notice requirement. Bond reduced to $750 cash with the following conditions: Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to possess or consume controlled substances without a prescription. No contact with Julie C. or her residence.
